quotes.text: The void doesn't consume you. It reveals who you've always been.
quotes.commentary: We fear emptiness because it strips away our illusions. But in that stripping lies truth—raw, unfiltered, and undeniable.

quotes.text: Chaos is not the enemy of order. It is the womb from which all order is born.
quotes.commentary: Every structure, every system, every belief—all emerged from primordial chaos. To reject chaos is to reject creation itself.

quotes.text: The mind is a prison only when you forget you hold the key.
quotes.commentary: We construct elaborate cages of thought, then wonder why we feel trapped. Liberation begins with recognizing our own hand in our captivity.

quotes.text: To understand darkness, one must first cease running from it.
quotes.commentary: Light and shadow are not opposites—they are partners in the dance of existence. Only by embracing both do we see clearly.

quotes.text: Every truth you hold dear is one perspective away from being a lie.
quotes.commentary: Certainty is the death of wisdom. The moment we believe we know everything, we stop learning anything.

quotes.text: Power isn't in dominating others. It's in mastering yourself.
quotes.commentary: The greatest conquest is not of lands or people, but of one's own impulses, fears, and limitations.

hiddenQuotes.text: Silence speaks louder than screams to those who know how to listen.
hiddenQuotes.commentary: In a world of noise, the deepest truths whisper. Only those who cultivate stillness can hear them.

hiddenQuotes.text: The paradox of freedom: we're most free when we accept our chains.
hiddenQuotes.commentary: True liberation doesn't come from breaking every constraint, but from choosing which ones to embrace.

paradoxes: The more you seek happiness, the more it eludes you.
To know yourself is to realize you never can.
The strongest walls are built from the softest beliefs.
We fear death yet waste the life we have.
The truth will set you free, but first it will destroy you.
To be rational, one must acknowledge the limits of reason.
The only constant is change, yet we cling to permanence.
We seek meaning in a universe indifferent to our existence.
